TypeSignature.Value: Public Interface ICursor Implements ICloseable, IDisposable, IJavaPeerable
public interface class ICursor : IDisposable, Java::Interop::IJavaPeerable, Java::IO::ICloseable
public interface ICursor : IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.IO.ICloseable
.class public interface auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ICursor implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class System.IDisposable
type ICursor = interface interface ICloseable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: This interface provides random read-write access to the result set returned by a database query.

remarks.para: This interface provides random read-write access to the result set returned by a database query.
Cursor implementations are not required to be synchronized so code using a Cursor from multiple threads should perform its own synchronization when using the Cursor.
Implementations should subclass AbstractCursor.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Closes the Cursor, releasing all of its resources and making it completely invalid.

remarks.para: Closes the Cursor, releasing all of its resources and making it completely invalid. Unlike #deactivate() a call to #requery() will not make the Cursor valid again.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyStringToBuffer(int32 columnIndex, class Android.Database.CharArrayBuffer buffer) cil managed
abstract member CopyStringToBuffer : int * Android.Database.CharArrayBuffer -> unit

Docs.param: the zero-based index of the target column. if the target column is null, return buffer
the buffer to copy the text into.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the requested column text and stores it in the buffer provided.

remarks.para: Retrieves the requested column text and stores it in the buffer provided. If the buffer size is not sufficient, a new char buffer will be allocated and assigned to CharArrayBuffer.data
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Deactivate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Deactivates the Cursor, making all calls on it fail until #requery is called.

remarks.para: Deactivates the Cursor, making all calls on it fail until #requery is called. Inactive Cursors use fewer resources than active Cursors. Calling #requery will make the cursor active again.
This member is deprecated. Since #requery() is deprecated, so too is this.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetBlob (columnIndex As Integer) As Byte()
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetBlob(int32 columnIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: the zero-based index of the target column.
Docs.summary: Returns the value of the requested column as a byte array.
Docs.returns: the value of that column as a byte array.

remarks.para: Returns the value of the requested column as a byte array.
The result and whether this method throws an exception when the column value is null or the column type is not a blob type is implementation-defined.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function GetColumnIndex (columnName As String) As Integer
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetColumnIndex(string columnName) cil managed

Docs.param: the name of the target column.
Docs.summary: Returns the zero-based index for the given column name, or -1 if the column doesn't exist.
Docs.returns: the zero-based column index for the given column name, or -1 if the column name does not exist.

remarks.para: Returns the zero-based index for the given column name, or -1 if the column doesn't exist. If you expect the column to exist use #getColumnIndexOrThrow(String) instead, which will make the error more clear.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: the name of the target column.

Docs.returns: the zero-based column index for the given column name

remarks.para: Returns the zero-based index for the given column name, or throws IllegalArgumentException if the column doesn't exist. If you're not sure if a column will exist or not use #getColumnIndex(String) and check for -1, which is more efficient than catching the exceptions.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the column does not exist

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function Move (offset As Integer) As Boolean
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Move(int32 offset) cil managed

Docs.param: the offset to be applied from the current position.
Docs.summary: Move the cursor by a relative amount, forward or backward, from the current position.
Docs.returns: whether the requested move fully succeeded.

remarks.para: Move the cursor by a relative amount, forward or backward, from the current position. Positive offsets move forwards, negative offsets move backwards. If the final position is outside of the bounds of the result set then the resultant position will be pinned to -1 or count() depending on whether the value is off the front or end of the set, respectively.

This method will return true if the requested destination was reachable, otherwise, it returns false. For example, if the cursor is at currently on the second entry in the result set and move(-5) is called, the position will be pinned at -1, and false will be returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToFirst() cil managed

Docs.summary: Move the cursor to the first row.
Docs.returns: whether the move succeeded.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to the first row.
This method will return false if the cursor is empty.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToNext() cil managed

Docs.summary: Move the cursor to the next row.
Docs.returns: whether the move succeeded.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to the next row.
This method will return false if the cursor is already past the last entry in the result set.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function MoveToPosition (position As Integer) As Boolean
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToPosition(int32 position) cil managed

Docs.param: the zero-based position to move to.
Docs.summary: Move the cursor to an absolute position.
Docs.returns: whether the requested move fully succeeded.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to an absolute position. The valid range of values is -1 <= position <= count.
This method will return true if the request destination was reachable, otherwise, it returns false.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveToPrevious() cil managed

Docs.summary: Move the cursor to the previous row.
Docs.returns: whether the move succeeded.

remarks.para: Move the cursor to the previous row.
This method will return false if the cursor is already before the first entry in the result set.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterContentObserver(class Android.Database.ContentObserver observer) cil managed

Docs.param: the object that gets notified when the content backing the cursor changes.
Docs.summary: Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the content backing this cursor.

remarks.para: Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the content backing this cursor. Typically the data set won't change until #requery() is called.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterDataSetObserver(class Android.Database.DataSetObserver observer) cil managed

Docs.param: the object that gets notified when the cursors data set changes.
Docs.summary: Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the contents of the this cursors data set, for example, when the data set is changed via #requery(), #deactivate(), or #close().

remarks.para: Register an observer that is called when changes happen to the contents of the this cursors data set, for example, when the data set is changed via #requery(), #deactivate(), or #close().
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Requery() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs the query that created the cursor again, refreshing its contents.
Docs.returns: true if the requery succeeded, false if not, in which case the cursor becomes invalid.

remarks.para:
Performs the query that created the cursor again, refreshing its contents. This may be done at any time, including after a call to #deactivate.
Since this method could execute a query on the database and potentially take a while, it could cause ANR if it is called on Main (UI) thread. A warning is printed if this method is being executed on Main thread.
This member is deprecated. Don't use this. Just request a new cursor, so you can do this asynchronously and update your list view once the new cursor comes back.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function Respond (extras As Bundle) As Bundle
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle Respond(class Android.OS.Bundle extras) cil managed

Docs.param: extra values, or android.os.Bundle#EMPTY Bundle.EMPTY. Never null.
Docs.summary: This is an out-of-band way for the the user of a cursor to communicate with the cursor.
Docs.returns: extra values, or android.os.Bundle#EMPTY Bundle.EMPTY. Never null.

remarks.para: This is an out-of-band way for the the user of a cursor to communicate with the cursor. The structure of each bundle is entirely defined by the cursor.
One use of this is to tell a cursor that it should retry its network request after it reported an error.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub SetNotificationUri (cr As ContentResolver, uri As Uri)
public void SetNotificationUri (Android.Content.ContentResolver? cr, Android.Net.Uri? uri);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetNotificationUri(class Android.Content.ContentResolver cr, class Android.Net.Uri uri) cil managed
abstract member SetNotificationUri : Android.Content.ContentResolver * Android.Net.Uri -> unit

Docs.param: The content resolver from the caller's context. The listener attached to this resolver will be notified.
The content URI to watch.
Docs.summary: Register to watch a content URI for changes.

remarks.para: Register to watch a content URI for changes. This can be the URI of a specific data row (for example, "content://my_provider_type/23"), or a a generic URI for a content type.
Calling this overrides any previous call to #setNotificationUris(ContentResolver, List).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
